net.kuujo.vertigo.io

Class Feeder<T extends Output<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.kuujo.vertigo.io.Feeder<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The output type.

    public class Feeder<T extends Output<T>>
extends Object
    Provides an interface for feeding outputs using a handler that will be called whenever the given output is prepared to accept a single message.
    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Feeder(T output)

      Methods

      Creates a new feeder.
      Feeder<T> feedHandler(org.vertx.java.core.Handler<T> handler)
      Sets a feed handler on the feeder.
      long getFeedDelay()
      Returns the period the feeder will wait after a failed feed handler call.
      Feeder<T> setFeedDelay(long feedDelay)
      Sets the period the feeder will wait before calling the feed handler again if the feed handler is called but no messages are produced.
      void start()
      Starts the feeder.
      void stop()
      Stops the feeder.

        public static <T extends Output<T>> Feeder<T> createFeeder(T output)
        Creates a new feeder.
        Parameters:
        output - The output to which to feed messages.

        A new feeder.

      • feedHandler

        public Feeder<T> feedHandler(org.vertx.java.core.Handler<T> handler)
        Sets a feed handler on the feeder.
        Parameters:
        handler - A handler to be called each time a message should be fed to the feeder.
        Returns:

      • setFeedDelay

        public Feeder<T> setFeedDelay(long feedDelay)
        Sets the period the feeder will wait before calling the feed handler again if the feed handler is called but no messages are produced.
        Parameters:
        feedDelay - The feed delay in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        The feeder.

      • getFeedDelay

        public long getFeedDelay()
        Returns the period the feeder will wait after a failed feed handler call.
        Returns:
        The feed delay. Defaults to 10 milliseconds.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the feeder.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the feeder.
